homepageTopArticles.title: US e-commerce spend reached nearly $258B over the holidays
homepageTopArticles.snippet: Adobe Analytics data found consumer spending grew 6.8% compared to 2024, with buy now, pay later usage reaching a new high.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary:
AI-Generated Summary:
US e-commerce spending during the holidays in 2025 reached almost $258 billion, showing a 6.8% increase from the previous year. Buy now, pay later services also saw a surge in usage.
homepageTopArticles.rerankWhy: Highlights significant holiday e-commerce spending growth

homepageTopArticles.title: Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026
homepageTopArticles.snippet:
As we enter into 2026, inflation rates are increasing as prices continued to edge up at the end of last year. According to the British Retail Consortium, shop price inflation picked up to 0.7% year on year in December, against growth of 0.6% in November. This is in line with the 3-month average of 0.7%. […]
The post Inflation set to remain sticky in 2026 appeared first on Professional Jeweller.
homepageTopArticles.aiSummary: AI-Generated Summary: Inflation rates are on the rise in 2026, with shop price inflation increasing to 0.7% year on year in December according to the British Retail Consortium. This trend is expected to persist in the jewellery industry.
homepageTopArticles.rerankWhy: Discusses inflation impact on retail pricing
